document.title: Intel® PROSet/Wireless Wi-Fi Software and Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® Advisory

notes.title: Summary
notes.text: Potential security vulnerabilities in some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software, Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi  and Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® may allow denial of service or information disclosure. Intel is releasing software updates to mitigate these potential vulnerabilities.

notes.title: Legal Notices and Disclaimers
notes.text:
Intel provides these materials as-is, with no express or implied warranties.
All products, dates, and figures specified are preliminary based on current expectations, and are subject to change without notice. 
Intel products and services described may contain design defects or errors known as errata, which may cause the product to deviate from published specifications. Current characterized errata are available on request.
Intel products that have met their End of Servicing Updates may no longer receive functional and security updates. For additional details on support and servicing, please see this help article. (https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/articles/000022396/processors.html)
Intel technologies' features and benefits depend on system configuration and may require enabled hardware, software or service activation. Performance varies depending on system configuration. No product or component can be absolutely secure. Check with your system manufacturer or retailer or learn more at http://intel.com.(http://intel.com) 
Some results have been estimated or simulated using internal Intel analysis or architecture simulation or modeling, and provided to you for informational purposes. Any differences in your system hardware, software or configuration may affect your actual performance. 
Intel and the Intel logo are trademarks of Intel Corporation or its subsidiaries in the United States and other countries. 
© Intel Corporation. Intel, the Intel logo, and other Intel marks are trademarks of Intel Corporation or its subsidiaries. Other names and brands may be claimed as the property of others.

notes.title: Recommendation
notes.text:
Intel recommends updating Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software, Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi and Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® to version 23.40 or later. 
Updates are available for download at this location:
Wi-Fi update Kit: 818005 
Bluetooth® update Kit: 818008

notes.title: Contact
notes.text: Contact Intel PSIRT at mailto:secure@intel.com with any questions, requests for technical details, or proposed coordination with other parties. Please encrypt any sensitive details using our PGP key, which can be found at https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/security-center/pgp-public-key.html.

notes.title: External Communications
notes.text: Intel is interested in fostering a coordinated release of external communications. Intel requests that customers hold external communications per the disclosure plans defined in /document/tracking/initial_release_date and document/tracking/current_release_date. This information is Intel Confidential and is shared under NDA. Access to this information should be restricted to only those in your organization with a need to know, such as those involved in the analysis, validation, and deployment of security updates. If you believe any additional external communication is required before the target date for Intels public disclosure, please contact Intel PSIRT (secure@intel.com)

names: CVE-2024-24984 was found externally. The remaining issues were found internally by Intel employees.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper input validation in firmware for some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi wireless products before version 23.40 may allow an unauthenticated user to enable denial of service via adjacent access.

notes.title: Root Cause Summary
notes.text: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

notes.title: Vulnerability Overview
notes.text: An unskilled user with no authentication via adjacent network access can potentially impact availability (high) through denial of service by means of improper input validation in Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi firmware.

notes.title: High Level Technical Summary
notes.text: CVE-2024-28049: Improper input validation in wireless firmware, may allow firmware crash.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper input validation for some Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® products for Windows before version 23.40 may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable denial of service via adjacent access.

notes.title: Root Cause Summary
notes.text: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

notes.title: Vulnerability Overview
notes.text: An unskilled user with no authentication via adjacent network access can potentially impact availability (high) through denial of service by means of improper input validation in some Intel® Wireless Bluetooth products for Windows within Ring 1: Device Drivers.

notes.title: High Level Technical Summary
notes.text: CVE-2024-24984: Improper input validation of certain packets in Intel® Wireless Bluetooth® may allow temporary DoS against the firmware, recoverable after a platform reset.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper input validation in firmware for some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi products before version 23.40 may allow an unauthenticated user to enable denial of service via adjacent access.

notes.title: Root Cause Summary
notes.text: The product receives input or data, but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the properties that are required to process the data safely and correctly.

notes.title: Vulnerability Overview
notes.text: An unskilled user with no authentication via adjacent network access can potentially impact availability (high) through denial of service by means of improper input validation in some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi firmware.

notes.title: High Level Technical Summary
notes.text: CVE-2024-23198, CVE-2024-28049: Improper input validation in wireless firmware, may allow firmware crash.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper initialization in firmware for some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi before version 23.40 may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.

notes.title: Root Cause Summary
notes.text: The product does not initialize or incorrectly initializes a resource, which might leave the resource in an unexpected state when it is accessed or used.

notes.title: Vulnerability Overview
notes.text: An unskilled user with enhanced user authentication via local operating system access can potentially impact availability (high) through denial of service by means of improper initialization in some Intel® PROSet/Wireless Software and Intel® Killer™ Wi-Fi firmware.

notes.title: High Level Technical Summary
notes.text: CVE-2024-25563: Improper initialization of device memory access may allow information disclosure of some Wireless LAN association keys.
